CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1953, pg. 3 reads: " What'll Thanksgiving Mean to Them" - This widowed mother Mrs. Edna Williams, and her six children live in one room at 1541 Centre Avenue. The mother has been trying for years to find a larger place.  in center is Mrs. Williams.  She is holding a grandchild, one-year-old Deneese Louise, who sometimes shares the crowded "home."  Front, left, Lula Mae, 12, right, Naomi,11.  Back, left, Edna Mae, 14, and right, Ralph, 15.  Harold, 10, and Robert, 8 (the two boys who can't walk), are pictured separate."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Edna Williams, in center, holding grandchild Deneese Louise, with clockwise: daughters Lula Mae and Edna Mae; son Ralph, and daughter Naomi, posed in single room apartment 1541 Centre Avenue
